avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow is settling and has thawed in warm conditions and gaining strength. Risk of slip and slide in icey conditions early morning high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has thawed and significantly melted in the warmth of the past week. Continued warmth is expected and stiff easterly winds. The snow is likely to have become isothermal up to the highest mountain peaks. There is a risk of slip and slide in ice conditions early in the day in the highest mountains.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack. New snow will fall in the East- and North of the country on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift into wind slabs in the mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. New snow will fall on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift and form wind slabs.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlægar áttir, milt og fremur þurrt. Næturfrost til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.comment: There have been no reports of avalanches since the warming on Monday, March 4th. A slab released in Skálavík on Sunday, March 3rd. Some small loose avalanches occurred on thin layers after the thaw last weekend in Seljalandsdal.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted in the recent warm weather, and measurements indicate that the snowpack has become isothermal in many mountainous areas. It can be expected to further strengthen with overnight frost in the coming days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A significant amount of snow melted during this week"s warm weather, and temperatures have been above freezing both in the mountains and in low-lying areas since Monday. Snow stakes indicate that the snowpack has generally reached isothermal conditions after the warmth. It can be expected that it will further consolidate in the cooling weather and overnight frost in the coming days.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack. New snow will fall in the East- and North of the country on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift into wind slabs in the mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. New snow will fall on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift and form wind slabs.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægur vindur og bjart veður, en NA 8-13 og skýjað síðdegis á mánudag en milt í veðri og hiti 1 til 6 stig að  deginum. Búast má við NA éljagangi til fjalla á þriðjudag og miðvikudag og vindflekamyndun í kjölfarið.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several small avalanches, minor slabs, and loose snow avalanches released on SE aspects during warming in the beginning of last week. On Saturday, a roughly 50-meter wide slab released on a steep S aspect in Upsadal above Dalvík, likely triggered by snowmobile activity.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened considerably after prolonged warming up in the mountains last week and overnight freezing over the weekend. Instability found last weekend may still be present in upper elevations and the interior of Tröllaskagi.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack has strengthened during warming in all elevations since Monday and overnight freezing over the weekend. Hardpack snow is widespread. Diurnal temperature fluctuations affect surface snow on S-aspects where solar effect is greatest. Weakness may still exist in higher elevations and in the interior of Tröllaskagi.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack. New snow will fall in the East- and North of the country on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift into wind slabs in the mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. New snow will fall on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift and form wind slabs.

weatherForecast.highlights: Úrkomulítið og áfram kólnandi veður á mánudag og snýr í austan 6-12 m/s og él með kvöldinu.

avalancheActivity.comment: Rather small slab avalanches released 6th March due to solar radiation in highest mountains in Fjarðarheiði and around Seyðisfjörður. When temperature rose on Monday several avalanches released in the forecasting area. Off piste skiers triggered three slab avalanches on March 2nd, both in Stafdalur and Oddsskarð.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. In the lower parts of the mountains, the snow should strengthen in the coming days and generally be stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Higher up in the mountains, there may be old wind slabs and layered snow that previous thawing hasn"t had time to settle. Observation near Oddsskarð showed rather uniform and stable snow but moist layered snow in the top 20 cm. In the lower parts of the mountains, the snow should strengthen in the coming days and generally be stable. Some new snow since this weekend but new windslabs could build up in stiff NE-winds with snowshowers.

travelAdvisory.comment: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. Over the next few days, temperatures will cool slightly, and we can expect overnight frost and diurnal temperature fluctuations, which further strengthen the snowpack. New snow will fall in the East- and North of the country on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift into wind slabs in the mountains.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A lot of snow melted last week around the country and the remaining snow has gone through freeze-thaw cycles. New snow will fall on Tuesday and Wednesday that could drift and form wind slabs.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg A-NA átt með snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu á láglendi. Vaxandi vindur þegar líður á vikuna og má búast við skafrenningi.
